intro: Impatiens runssorensis, commonly known as the Runssorensis Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and grows as an upright herbaceous perennial. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
